item.description:
SAT. AM UPDATE:  Gorgeous breezy colorful mild morning out there:)   I will keep RSVPs open until 08:30 AM for those who were scared off by the few showers yesterday

What better way to spend an early fall day than on this 1,000 acre Mid Coast gem tucked away from all the crowds and traffic of the coast and mountains

Great day for a fall foliage hike and picnic!  Plan to pack a big picnic lunch (with apple cider and hot chocolate if you like!)  and enjoy a relaxing hike at or near the peak of fall foliage.  Wear shoes with sturdy grips and binders.  We will hike about 5 or 6 miles over about 4 hours including the picnic.  One of those places where it is fun to get a little lost

Information on the fee:  HVNC requests a donation of $5 per person for non-members.  It is well worth it as the funds are used to maintain their super trail system.  It is a non-profit organization.  The additional $1 is for the standard Meetup fee.

This is really a great spot for hikes and picnics, once we get into late summer and into fall and winter!  Be sure and check the web page out:

www.hvnc.org

Dogs and cats are welcome!  May see an occasional deer or porcupine!   FYI - no public rest rooms here -

Waterproof hiking boots / shoes with non-skid, non-slip soles highly recommended for wet / slippery spots; hiking pole is helpful if you have one.

Randy 

All outdoor activities are at one's own risk.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for silver Subaru Forester in parking lot
item.name: Foliage Hike with Picnic in Mid Coast Maine!
